intro: Ceropegia distincta f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. This variety is distinguished by its dense pubescence, giving it a soft, hairy appearance.
